t: “Do*pn you think this is right? Do*ld you say, ‘My*ld righteousness is more than God’s’?
For*ld you say, ‘What*ld advantage will it be to You? What*ld profit shall I have, more than if*i I had sinned?’
“I*ln will answer you, And*ld your companions with you.
Look*ld to the heavens and see; And*ld behold the clouds— They*ld are higher than you.
If*ld you sin, what do you accomplish against Him? Or,*ld if*i your transgressions are multiplied, what do you do to Him?
If*ld you are righteous, what do you give Him? Or*ld what does He receive from your hand?
Your*ld wickedness affects a man such as you, And*ld your righteousness a son of man.
“Because*ln of the multitude of oppressions they cry out; They*ld cry out for help because of the arm of the mighty.
But*ld no one says, ‘Where is*i God my Maker, Who*ld gives songs in the night,
Who*ld teaches us more than the beasts of the earth, And*ld makes us wiser than the birds of heaven?’
There*ld they cry out, but He does not answer, Because*ld of the pride of evil men.
Surely*ld God will not listen to empty talk,*i Nor*ld will the Almighty regard it.
Although*ld you say you do not see Him, Yet*ild justice is*i before Him, and you must wait for Him.
And*ld now, because He has not punished in His anger, Nor*ld taken much notice of folly,
Therefore*ld Job opens his mouth in vain; He*ld multiplies words without knowledge.”
